follow_up_questions.selected_insight: Agriculture and Fishing is the dominant economic sector with the highest employment in Kiribati, Solomon Islands, Tonga, and Vanuatu, highlighting its critical role in the labor market of these Pacific Island Countries.
selected_facts: The highest (most) value of the Number of employed persons is Economic sector Agriculture and Fishing when Pacific Island Countries is Kiribati.
The highest (most) value of the Number of employed persons is Economic sector Agriculture and Fishing when Pacific Island Countries is Solomon Islands.
The highest (most) value of the Number of employed persons is Economic sector Agriculture and Fishing when Pacific Island Countries is Tonga.
The highest (most) value of the Number of employed persons is Economic sector Agriculture and Fishing when Pacific Island Countries is Vanuatu.
The Economic sector Agriculture and Fishing accounts for 29.88% of the Number of employed persons when Pacific Island Countries is Vanuatu.
follow_up_questions.question: How does the number of employed persons vary across different Pacific Island Countries?
follow_up_questions.suggested_viz_title: Employment Numbers Across Pacific Island Countries
follow_up_questions.rationale: This high-level question explores employment distribution by country, providing a broad view of labor market size differences without focusing on sectors or other categories.

follow_up_questions.selected_insight: Solomon Islands consistently has the highest number of employed persons across multiple categories including overall employment, sex, and key economic sectors such as Agriculture and Fishing and Financial and Insurance.

The highest (most) value of the Number of employed persons is Pacific Island Countries Solomon Islands when Economic sector is Financial and Insurance.

The highest (most) value of the Number of employed persons is Pacific Island Countries Solomon Islands when Sex is Female.
The Pacific Island Countries Solomon Islands accounts for 34.42% of the Number of employed persons when Economic sector is Agriculture and Fishing.
follow_up_questions.question: How does the number of employed persons in Solomon Islands differ by Sex and Economic sector?
follow_up_questions.suggested_viz_title: Employment in Solomon Islands by Sex and Sector
follow_up_questions.rationale: This question drills down into the significant observation that Solomon Islands leads in employment overall and across sexes and sectors, revealing employment distribution within the country.

follow_up_questions.selected_insight: Agriculture and Fishing is the dominant economic sector for both sexes, showing the highest number of employed persons and representing the largest share of employment for males and females across the dataset.
selected_facts: The highest (most) value of the Number of employed persons is Sex Male when Economic sector is Agriculture and Fishing.
The highest (most) value of the Number of employed persons is Economic sector Agriculture and Fishing when Sex is Male.
The highest (most) value of the Number of employed persons is Economic sector Agriculture and Fishing when Sex is Female.
The Sex Male accounts for 34.42% of the Number of employed persons when Economic sector is Agriculture and Fishing.

In the Number of employed persons ranking of different Economic sector(s), the top three Economic sector(s) are Agriculture and Fishing, Agriculture and Fishing, Wholesale and Retail  when Sex is Female.

In the Number of employed persons ranking of different Economic sector(s), the top three Economic sector(s) are Agriculture and Fishing, Agriculture and Fishing, Wholesale and Retail  when Sex is Male.
follow_up_questions.question: How does the number of employed persons vary by Sex across the dataset?
follow_up_questions.suggested_viz_title: Number of Employed Persons by Sex
follow_up_questions.rationale: This question builds on the insight about dominant sectors by focusing on employment distribution by Sex at a high level, enabling comparisons of gender employment share generally.

follow_up_questions.selected_insight: Across Pacific Island Countries, Solomon Islands and Nauru have the highest number of employed males while Cook Islands, Niue, Tuvalu, and Solomon Islands have the lowest number of employed females, indicating a prominent gender employment disparity by country.
selected_facts: The highest (most) value of the Number of employed persons is Sex Male when Pacific Island Countries is Solomon Islands.
The highest (most) value of the Number of employed persons is Pacific Island Countries Solomon Islands when Sex is Male.
The Sex Male accounts for 32.25% of the Number of employed persons when Pacific Island Countries is Solomon Islands.
In the Number of employed persons ranking of different Pacific Island Countries(s), the top three Pacific Island Countries(s) are Solomon Islands, Vanuatu, Solomon Islands  when Sex is Male.
The highest (most) value of the Number of employed persons is Sex Female when Pacific Island Countries is Micronesia (Federated States of).
The highest (most) value of the Number of employed persons is Sex Female when Pacific Island Countries is Cook Islands.
The lowest (least) value of the Number of employed persons is Sex Male when Pacific Island Countries is Cook Islands.
The lowest (least) value of the Number of employed persons is Sex Female when Pacific Island Countries is Niue.
The lowest (least) value of the Number of employed persons is Sex Female when Pacific Island Countries is Tuvalu.
The Sex Female accounts for 28.49% of the Number of employed persons when Pacific Island Countries is Tokelau.
The lowest (least) value of the Number of employed persons is Sex Female when Pacific Island Countries is Solomon Islands.
The highest (most) value of the Number of employed persons is Sex Male when Pacific Island Countries is Nauru.
In the Number of employed persons ranking of different Pacific Island Countries(s), the last three Pacific Island Countries(s) are Niue, Tuvalu, Tokelau  when Sex is Male.
In the Number of employed persons ranking of different Pacific Island Countries(s), the last three Pacific Island Countries(s) are Niue, Niue, Tuvalu  when Sex is Female.
follow_up_questions.question: How does the number of employed persons differ by Sex and Pacific Island Countries, highlighting gender employment gaps?
follow_up_questions.suggested_viz_title: Employed Persons by Sex and Pacific Island Countries
follow_up_questions.rationale: This question drills down into the gender employment disparity across countries, providing finer detail on how Sex and Pacific Island Countries interact to reveal significant employment inequality.
